page.title: 05Ecology west: FINTRY
page.content: The main feature is the{Endrick Water, meandering through mixed farmland - grass, cereals, turnips, potatoes. On its banks, willow scrub-sallow, purple osier; by tributary streams, deciduous woodland - oak, ash, alder, birch; also coniferous shelter belts - Norway or Sitka spruce or larch. Slopes of {N.Campsie Fells & Ballindalloch Moor}: Permanent grassland - fescues, mat- grass, rushes; wet heath and moorland with some afforestation - cotton grass heather, cross-leaved heath, purple moor grass, deer sedge, hare's - tail. { {Sites of Special Scientific Interest: {Ballikinrain Woods:} Mixed habitats - rhododendron, bluebell, wood sorrel, birch polyipore, willow warbler. {Endrick Water (Broughmore):}Riverbank woodland - kingfisher, dipper, mallard oyster catcher,mink, otter, watervole.
